content.question: In an experiment, a researcher showed children a video of a person interacting with a doll. Half of the children watched a video of a person behaving violently toward a doll, and the other half saw a video of a person playing nicely with a doll. The researcher also looked at whether the gender and age of the child made a difference in how they interacted with the doll. In this study, the dependent variable was

choices.label: the age at which children begin engaging in parallel play
the way children interact with a doll
watching a video in which a person exhibits violent behavior toward a doll or plays nicely with a doll

content.answer: the way children interact with a doll

topic.text: 3.9: Social, Cognitive, and Neurological Factors in Learning
